item.title: Integration Testing
item.description: Integration Testing Integration testing is the second stage of the software testing process, following [[notes/Unit Testing|Unit Testing]]. Integration testing involves verifying that each individual software component can work together.

item.title: Regression Testing
item.description: Regression Testing Regression testing refers to a testing technique that runs functional and non-functional tests to ensure that the functionality of existing features works as intended.

item.title: Unit Testing
item.description: Unit Testing Unit testing is a testing descrete behaviours of your program as individual units. The tests need to verify the standard, boundary and incorrect cases of input and also check any assumptions made by the code.
